The VERY first thing that you're shown as a new player the very first time you login is a giant, annoying popup that takes up the entire screen trying to get you to open the game's in game cash shop.

I miss OW1. 

The general timeline and story:

-OW2 is announced 
-Blizzard has a scandal
-OW1 allegedly could not be updated for the PVE Gameplay Modes 
-Blizzard has a scandal
-OW1 was shuttered for OW2 
-Blizzard has a scandal
-OW2 launches WITHOUT the PVE Gameplay modes that necessitated shuttering of OW1 
-Blizzard has a scandal
-OW2 launches WITH a bunch of cash shop BS AND LOCKED CHARACTERS BEHIND A BATTLEPASS
-Blizzard has a scandal
-OW2 will NOT be getting any PVE mode, announced Blizzard

So why in the gosh darn heck was OW1 shuttered and rereleased as this stripped down shell of it's former self?

Also, why are all the characters suddenly gay?

I played the 3 story missions so you don't have to. 

For $15 you only get 3 story missions that took me 1:22:12 to finish. To sum it all up, these 3 missions are basically like the free Archives missions we got in OW1 but with a price tag on them.

The main difference between the OW1 free Archives missions and the the 3 story missions are that these missions uses bigger maps and has a $15 tag on them (I'm not even kidding). The best things about these missions are the excellent music and pre- and post-mission cinematics which you can find and watch on YouTube.
wtf even is this game??? But I am addicted.
Been playing this game over 6 years, still addicted.

Welcome to Steam Blizzard :)

Overwatch 2 is a bad game.

This game is as Terrible as things can get. You think you want to, but trust me you dont want to. Go buy all Destiny 2 DLCs instead and its less of a money waste compared to this piece of crap. OW1 brought a new genre and blizzard drove it into the ground. The sheer amount of greed that corrupted this once gem of a Game should be illegal. Remove every bit of free stuff from the game, sell skins for an absurd asking price and make every new Champion more noob friendly so more people get attracted to it. Overwatch didnt need more players, Overwatch needed Devs that keep their promises and listen to the playerbase. 15 Dollars for 3 missions that have absolutely no gameplay value. After finishing every PVE mission in 1.2 Hours it feels like i paid 15$ for cinematics, which i could have watched on Youtube. I hope everyone on the Overwatch developing team, that thinks what theyre doing is "right" should lose their Job and never be allowed to Work on a Video Game. Dont rebrand a good game, to make it worse and praise it as "free to play" after recycling the first game and taking every bit of fun out of it. Congratulations, you killed it. Literally.
